text: Hey, I have been trying to save multiple plots with different names through a loop. I am looking for the Julia equivalent of python script: plt.savefig('ID+str(i).‘png’). I tested this savefig(“C:/Julia_data/ID”+str(i) “.pdf”) but obviously it does work.

elements.text: Hey, I have been trying to save multiple plots with different names through a loop. I am looking for the Julia equivalent of python script: plt.savefig('ID+str(i).‘png’). I tested this savefig(“C:/Julia_data/ID”+str(i) “.pdf”) but obviously it does work.

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

As a quick fix `savefig("C:/Julia_data/ID" * string(i) * ".pdf")` , string concatenation in Julia is made with `*` . Also you can do <https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/manual/strings/#string-interpolation|string interpolation>  `savefig("C:/Julia_data/ID$(i).pdf")` .
